title: Week 4 Quiz: Financing Mechanics
description: Test your knowledge of capital structure and advanced grammar.

items.prompt: A loan that requires regular payments of both principal and interest is:
items.explanation: Amortization reduces the principal balance over time.

items.prompt: Complete the formal hypothetical: '___ the interest rate to double, the project would become unviable.'
items.explanation: 'Were + subject + to + verb' is a formal way to express a future hypothetical.

items.prompt: Common Stock usually gives the holder:
options: The key to the bank vault
items.explanation: Common shareholders are the residual owners of the business.

options: The loan is paid in many small parts
The entire principal is paid at the end of the term
items.explanation: Bullet maturities create 'refinancing risk' at the end of the loan.

items.prompt: If a company 'leverages' its equity, it is:
options: Using debt to increase potential returns
items.explanation: Leverage amplifies both gains and losses.
